handist.collections.reducer

Class Reducer<R extends Reducer<R,T>,T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • mpi.User_function
      • handist.collections.reducer.Reducer<R,T>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - the implementing type itself, this is used to correctly implement reflective methods (methods that act on the implementing type itself)
    T - the type from which data is acquired to compute the reduction
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public abstract class Reducer<R extends Reducer<R,T>,T>
extends mpi.User_function
implements Serializable
    Reducer object. This object provides an abstract reduction operation on some data element T. Implementations should provide the reduce(Object), merge(Reducer) and newReducer() methods.

    As an example implementation, we provide the example below which performs the sum over Integers. 

     class SumReduction extends Reducer<SumReduction, Integer> {
     int runningSum = 0;

     public void merge(SumReduction r) {
         runningSum += r.runningSum;
     }

     public void reduce(Integer i) {
         runningSum += i;
     }

     public void newReducer() {
         return new SumReduction();
     }
 }
    Author:
    Patrick Finnerty
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Call

        public void Call(Object firstOperandArray,
                 int firstOperandArrayOffset,
                 Object secondOperandAndResultArray,
                 int secondOperandArrayOffset,
                 int count,
                 mpi.Datatype datatype)
        This method is called by the MPI runtime to make the reduction happen between objects. You do not need to override this method, and do so at your own peril.
        Specified by:
        Call in class mpi.User_function

      • globalReduction

        public void globalReduction(TeamedPlaceGroup placeGroup,
                            apgas.util.GlobalID gid)
        Performs the global reduction of this instance. This method needs to be called when the reduction operation took place over data distributed across multiple hosts. In such a case, the reducer will have one instance per host in which the local result if contained. This method is used to merge the results of all the local reducers and make them reflect the global result of the reduction.

        An implementation does not need to override this method. However, users should make sure that method merge(Reducer) was appropriately implemented. Otherwise, problems may arise.

        Parameters:
        placeGroup - the group of places on which "local" reductions have been performed
        gid - global id under which each local instance is registered
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this instance is not allowed to perform global reductions

      • merge

        public abstract void merge(R reducer)
        Merges the partial reduction given as parameter into this instance. This method is used by the library when the reduction is being parallelized and multiple instances of the implementing type obtained through method newReducer() have been used and the partial result of each of these instances need to be combined into a single instance.
        Parameters:
        reducer - another instance of the implementing class whose partial reduction needs to be merged into this instance

      • newReducer

        public abstract R newReducer()
        Creates a new R instance and returns it. The returned element should be the neutral element of the reduction operation being implemented, that is, calling method merge(Reducer) with the object returned by this method without there being any call to reduce(Object) should not influence the result of the reduction, or throw any exception.
        Returns:
        a new R instance which is going to be used to parallelize the reduction

      • reduce

        public abstract void reduce(T input)
        Takes the object given as parameter and performs the reduction operation this object implements.
        Parameters:
        input - an instance of the object on which the reduction operation is taking place

      • teamReduction

        public R teamReduction(TeamedPlaceGroup placeGroup)
        This
        Parameters:
        placeGroup - into which this instance is participating
